SEARCH
Package org.example.oopproject1.controller

Class RecruiterController

java.lang.Object
org.example.oopproject1.controller.RecruiterController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/recruiters") public class RecruiterController extends Object
REST controller for managing recruiter profiles.

Provides endpoints to create, retrieve, update, delete, and search recruiters, with optional pagination and role-based access control. Also exposes “/me” endpoints for the authenticated recruiter to manage their own profile, list their jobs, and view applications to their jobs.

Since:
1.0

    • getAllRecruiters

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recruiter>> getAllRecruiters()

      Returns:
      HTTP 200 with list of all recruiters

    • getRecruiterByEmail

      @GetMapping("/byEmail") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Recruiter> getRecruiterByEmail(@RequestParam String email)
      Retrieves a recruiter by email.
      Parameters:
      email - email address
      Returns:
      HTTP 200 with recruiter or 404 if not found

    • getPagedRecruiters

      @GetMapping("/paged") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Recruiter>> getPagedRecruiters(@RequestParam(defaultValue="0") int page, @RequestParam(defaultValue="10") int size, @RequestParam(defaultValue="name") String sortBy, @RequestParam(defaultValue="asc") String direction)
      Retrieves a paginated list of recruiters.
      Parameters:
      page - zero-based page index (default 0)
      size - page size (default 10)
      sortBy - field to sort by (default "name")
      direction - "asc" or "desc" (default "asc")
      Returns:
      HTTP 200 with a Page of recruiters

      Returns:
      HTTP 200 with recruiter

    • createRecruiter

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Recruiter> createRecruiter(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid Recruiter recruiter)
      Creates a new recruiter and associated user.
      Parameters:
      recruiter - payload; ID will be ignored
      Returns:
      HTTP 201 with created recruiter

    • updateRecruiter

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Recruiter> updateRecruiter(@PathVariable String id, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid Recruiter recruiter)
      Updates any recruiter by ID.
      Parameters:
      id - recruiter ID
      recruiter - updated data
      Returns:
      HTTP 200 with updated recruiter

    • deleteRecruiter

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteRecruiter(@PathVariable String id)
      Deletes a recruiter by ID (ADMIN only).
      Parameters:
      id - recruiter ID
      Returns:
      HTTP 204

      Parameters:
      company - company name
      Returns:
      HTTP 200 with list

    • getPagedRecruitersByCompany

      @GetMapping("/company/{company}/paged") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Recruiter>> getPagedRecruitersByCompany(@PathVariable String company, @RequestParam(defaultValue="0") int page, @RequestParam(defaultValue="10") int size, @RequestParam(defaultValue="name") String sortBy, @RequestParam(defaultValue="asc") String direction)
      Retrieves a paginated list of recruiters filtered by company.
      Parameters:
      company - company name
      page - zero-based page index
      size - page size
      sortBy - sort field
      direction - "asc" or "desc"
      Returns:
      HTTP 200 with Page
